result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian E. HARTLAUB Jr.

defendant.name: HARTLAUB, Brian E., Jr.
defendant.address: 300A S. 6th Street, PO Box 267, St.Nazianz, WI 54232

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in all counts.  The defendant plead to charges of bail jumping, false imprisonment and OWI causing injury with minor child in vehicle in case no: 13 CF 31 and 13 CF 411.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
Plea and sentencing hearing is reset for 08-21-14 at 9:00 a.m. in Branch 2.
Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to a Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-15-14 at 4:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 10-02-14 at 10:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Petition for Appointment of an Attorney; Affidavit of Indigency and Order.
Order Appointing Attorney Adam Snavely as counsel of record through Manitowoc County.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives his statutory time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-11-14 at 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-09-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Letter from State Public Defender to the Court.
At 3:35 p.m., $250.00 cash bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-02-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with Amy Muzik.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
